reviews.text: If it's not raining in Aberdeen, I recommend going to Footdee, as you won't find a second place like this. It's like a little town. It would be a great place to go for a walk with children.
Not to be missed when strolling along the beach in Aberdeen, interesting history and quaint houses
A gorgeous little part of the city, with small, short houses. It's worth seeing this place while visiting the city.
This is a place you must visit.  Fantastic
Lovely peerie place to walk around

It is the greenhouse effect huge garden, where you can see much varieties of plants and flowers with proper description Like diff cactus. It is a good place to bring kids. it is wheel chair friendly.it is free. there is a place inside where you can do some ceremony like a wedding.

I don't know how many times I been but a lot.
It's all time changing, before it was a shop with plants, which actually I like it most than restaurant, now it is very noisy place, I don't like where it is too many people. But few times I ordered a toast and was really good, but a bit high prices they got. Yeah it is a good place to bring kids and to show them about tropical plants and any normal plants, of course its not a big winter garden but it's okay. My favourite place was a cactus house haha because past years it was a quiet and warm place now its just a warm place. Now I like to pick up a photos because I I am a photographer and I am also an artist and I love painting with traditional plants, actually I can't find a lots of traditional flowers but I am glad it is anyway exist place like this one winter garden in Aberdeen.

Superb spot on a cold or damp day.  The smell of the hyacinths was heavenly and the cream colour an inspired choice.  Fascinating information on the agave plant.  The outdoor Japanese garden looked a little sad but was constructed on an interesting theme and I look forward to seeing it in better condtions.  Unfortunately on the Sunday I visited the toilets were closed at 5:15 when Gardens don't actually shut till 5:30. People use the toilets when they are leaving.  They should stay open til then.    There was  pay toilet in the park...surrounded by a gang of kids.

This is one of Aberdeens best public spaces. With outdoor and indoor gardens to explore it's worth a visit. Free entry and parking it's a great place to walk, sit, exercise or take the dog. There are 2 great cafes on site although they are quite expensive. Inside there are different types of garden, tropical, cactus house, fern garden, Japanese garden and ornamental gardens. There are things for the kids to see. McPuddle the frog and Spike the talking cactus. There are also 3 parks for the kids to play in.  Loads to keep all of the family entertained.

Always a star attraction , a must see destination. Great array of plants, statues, pools and of course McPuddock the frog which I think the adults love more than the kids. Very child friendly. Good cafe and ice cream parlour . Great place to visit if the rest of the park is too cold or wet. Very easy to spend several hours here. Also great for finding a quiet corner to read or draw. Highly recommend  a visit for all ages young to senior.

Great place to visit. Lots of good exhibits and a few interactive displays. Nice cafe at the bottom which doesn't break the bank. They also do free guided tours so you can learn more about the history of the area. My 6 year old granddaughter  didn't want to leave.

Absolutely fantastic place to go. It's also free  :) so much info and it's all lay out in a way where it's interesting and engaging. They seem to have activities and quizzes for children for learning etc. Can't wait to take my dad and my daughter will love it too.

Fantastic museum, worth around 1.5 to 2.5 hours of anyone's time if they are even remotely interested in the east coasts rich maritime heritage. Good exhibits, well enough explained and clean. I don't think I've seen a public museum or exhibition space so clean as here (anywhere in Europe) , whoever is in charge of this kudos, it's really pleasing to be there. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly and the galleries seem to change occasionally so worth popping your head in the door every now and then even if you've been before.
Did I mention it's free!? It is!

Fascinating history of Aberdeen Maritime. Great view of an oil rig in the centre of the building which shows you the depth they go down to. Would recommend this museum if you are visiting Aberdeen. Head to Fierce Bar for a beer flight afterwards!

It was unexpectedly dense with historical and scientific information.
This is a fantastic stop while visiting Aberdeen.
It really delves into what made Aberdeen.
Give it a whole day though, there is a lot more here than is expected.
Fantastic museum to visit. Nice cafe too. Volunteers were knowledgeable and very helpful. WW1 trench (new exhibit) was excellent. Well worth a visit if you are in the area 💖

A very friendly relaxed place to enjoy whether it be coming in for a cup of tea or touring the museum learning about all the fine treasures from over 200 years of regimental history. I enjoyed it so much and because the museum holds a dear and special place in my heart. I enjoyed spending my Summers during the school holidays at the museum with my granda. Now a veteran myself I decided to volunteer.
Very good people and great exhibits. Special thanks to Bill Stalker for talking us round. Great guy really passionate about the history of the regiment.
Always a warm welcome on arrival, food is freshly made and very tasty, a great place to recharge the batteries. The museum is amazing, should be on every ones "to do" list. Highly recommended.
Brilliant afternoon! The guides were excellent, lots of interesting stories. Cafe great!

Great facility. Should be more widely publicized by the proprietors. Presents excellent historical perspective of law and justice in Aberdeen several centuries ago. A place for reflecting on the past so we can make the present and the future better for everyone.

This is a delightful little museum charting the history of one of the oldest buildings in the city.    

It’s completely free entry and will take about 30-60 minutes to visit depending on how much you wish to read.

There are quite a few narrow winding staircases and dark rooms inside.
A good preservation of city's history. Presented a good representation of the conditions convicted murderers, debtors, alleged witches and others faced during the 17th and 18th centuries.

Interesting part of Aberdeen's history.  It is a 35 minutes museum. 

Very interesting.

Lovely cute museum and good for like half an hour of you're just looking but about a hour if you're stopping to read everything.
They provide you with an information leaflet and would answer any of your questions. 
A good place to visit while in Aberdeen. Walking distance from the city center and also the maritime museum.
It's great fun for the kids, it's free, the staff were really friendly and even let us see and touch some stuffed animals in one of the side rooms. Highly recommended for some time out in Aberdeen
Must visit museum,  small and great representation,  it's free entry,  well maintained,  can bring younger kids
Very interesting for all ages
Loads to see and you can always find new stuff hidden away. 2 stuffed tigers too, what more could you want!
Great place to go with a family. Free entry. I highly recommend visit
Brilliant! Get the nachos!
Very nice staff and the food was excellent. Didn't take long to arrive and was hot and fresh. Pretty consistent ordering at Pizza Express. There is a takeaway option also if you need to dash.
Very good pizza. Perfect service. I will come back for sure ;).
Such good food! At first it looks like a fast food restaurant but the food is really good quality and tasty!
Good pizza, slow service.
Delicious food. Friendly, helpful staff.

Great food with very cost ambience. Staff is very welcoming and are always there to help you. Parking near the restaurant can be little difficult at times since it is on the busy king street but again it depends on what time you are going there. I would highly recommend their curries. Food is of great quality and is very cheap.

First ever visit last Saturday night.  Very friendly staff and very efficient. Superb food and must admit the  butter chicken was 10 out of 10.  My 13 son scoffed every morsel.. ..so we shall return for more very soon
Great tasty food. Lovely atmosphere. Really appreciate the no alcohol policy. Friendly and helpful staff. Love this place.

What a fantastic find! We were staying nearby and went here for dinner with our family and so glad we did! The staff were really friendly and the food was delicious. It is a BYOB so be prepared if you want alcohol!
V. VIP Hotel and very impressive staff . Highly appreciate to shoaib ... Very well done guys
Nice restaurant. My pizza was good but my daughter got very few prawns in her pasta dish. Very nice server.

We went on an Itison voucher. Pizza or pasta each and a glass of wine. Waiter was very nice and attentive. The pizza and pasta was excellent with appropriately sized portions. The waiter even offered us free coffee at the end, but neither of us drink coffee. Still very much appreciated. We will be back!
Absolutely charming place in central Aberdeen with a lovely atmoshere. Food is great, you should definitely give it a go and I bet you'll come back..!
Love it its the best place to go on your birthday party or i diner out

Ordered a Prosciutto e Rucola from this place via Deliveroo but, as you can probably see, I got a 'shredded lettuce e two slices of prosciutto slapped on it' special. Pretty shocking to be honest.

Bit of a shame really...

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.
Friendly staff, nice food. We had a banquet for 7 people with a pile of beers. Loads of well prepared, tasty food and reasonably priced as well.
Really nice surroundings lovely friendly staff and great food.  Brilliant value for money.  Well worth a visit.
Fantastic food and friendly service. Only place that has good aromatic crispy duck. They make some great food.
Would give zero stars if possible. Food was terrible, and the service was even worse! Avoid like the plague.
Remember that You have to pay extra money for rice. Beef was... lets say "good" and the service really nice.
Great wee find. Delicious food. Staff v friendly!

Burgers are tasteless! Atmosphere is actually really good. Great for drinks, but wouldn't recommend for food. Live music is available on selected days. Service was reasonably fast and staff is friendly.

Staff were helpful and really friendly and because it was quiet they kept popping past and doing table service for drinks which was really nice. Only down side was the burgers  were stone cold but they were very apologetic when we told them and discounted the bill. Good customer service from them.

A renowned labyrinth-esque drinking establishment in the heart of Aberdeen. Can get very busy on a Saturday evening post match at Pittodrie, but this only adds to the atmosphere and charm of the place.
Typical local bar. Good feelings!

The best Indian in Aberdeen. The atmosphere was lovely, the service was excellent and the food... let me tell you. I like a good curry. I don't waste my time with cuisine that hasn't had love and care put into it. The price is totally reasonable for the quality of the meal. I won't be going anywhere else for Indian food in Aberdeen ever again. Thanks for a lovely family meal Nazma Tandoori!

Best Indian restaurant in Aberdeen by far. Probably best in Scotland. Great food. Great service. Finish off the meal with a coffee heated on a spirit burner and a brandy also on a heated burner, superb. Buffet lunch is great value for money.
Great food and service, very willing to modify dishes and really friendly staff
Foods and service was superb.  I should especially recommend the monkfish curries.

A nice Indian Restaurant in Aberdeen. 
The waiters are very attentive and also friendly. My friend asked if we could have more mint chocolates since we love it and they gave us two more.

The quality of the food was also nice, just as the variety of choice. It was not cheap, but also not expensive.

My chicken tandoori was a bit overgrilled as it was hard to chew on some already black parts but all in all it was good
Absolutely amazing experience. Extraordinary cocktails and CLASS staff. You can feel like within friends and family. Guys are doing something special, definitely the place to go.

I have visited this place so many times and never been disappointed. Selection of cocktails is spectacular, service is really good and food is fantastic. I love the fact they serve nibbles till very late, very rare to get that quality of food that late at night. Would definitely recommend to anyone!;)

Wow, such nice place. Great artisan cocktails and atmosphere, really nice to sit on the bar and speak to the bartenders and see them at work. Yes the price of the cocktails is more then usual but if you're coming once in a while for a nice evening it is well worth your cash.

Since renovation, the layout seems a bit more forced than cosy bar like it used to be. A place for whisky drinkers and cocktail drinks with great lists for both. Some members of staff very good with these lists and able to provide a helping hand if you want recommendations etc. Food used to be very good but is now very posh hipster. Cost is higher end but that's to be expected for whisky and cocktails (i cant comment on the usual beverages). I'll remain a regular!

My friend and I popped in for cocktails on 23rd of Feb. Sat at bar, one barman on and one waitress. No-one acknowledged us and so we waited,  4 women walked in and took a table and waitress acknowledged them. Still waited. We eventually left as staff didn't seem bothered. Ridiculous staffing for late afternoon on a Saturday. Won't be returning!

Its a steep walk down, but worse coming back up, but really worth the effort.   It's great to wonder about inside and you get great views of the sea and cliffs.  A must see if in the north east of Scotland!

Absolutely amazing. I would definitely recommend leaving your car in Stonehaven and walking from the Harbour. Breath taking views all the way. I happily spent nearly 2 hours in the castle and could have even spent longer. Best castle I've been too so far!

The BEST Castle in Scotland!!  There's no where else I've seen that's as dramatic and beautiful as this place. The cliff side is stunning and the ruins are amazingly intact. The amount of history is powerful as you stand within its walls. I go back repeatedly. :)

Beautiful castle! Been here twice already and it's still wonderful! It's nice to admire it from far and listen to the waves and the wind.
Entrance fee is £7 and it's worth to go in. There's a lot to see and you spend quite a long time in there. Lots of nice places to take photos inside.
The castle is a true treasure of Scotland, the UK and, in fact, the world. One of the most dramatic landscapes I have ever seen combined with the history and beauty of the castle. Simply outstanding.

Long drive to get here after checking it was open online. Only to find it’s closed. Considering how long the journey was N. Trust Scotland need to be aware this is misleading. Lovely looking castle and grounds.

Visited this beautiful castle in 2017, ( from Nova Scotia,  Canada).  My maiden name is Forbes so this visit was a dream come true for me.  Unfortunately the castle was closed  and did not get to go inside.  But just being there was amazing for me.

I was hosting a party of overseas guests on Saturday 23rd March and Craigievar Castle was a ‘must see’
I checked this site and had confirmation of opening times and indeed Google confirmed this by informed me,as I motored there, that I had a certain period of time for my visit!!
I arrived to find it closed FOR THE WINTER and not open until the season starts! 
Black marks to both Craigievar and indeed your goodselves for providing incorrect advice, causing a fifty miles fruitless journey and creating poor hospitality for my guests!

Fantastic tower house castle in a beautiful location. Offers a unique visitor experience, as there is no artificial lighting inside AND no photography is permitted inside so you really focus on just enjoying and immersing yourself in this historic site!
Not happy, we drove for an hour to get there and it was closed, even though online it said OPEN.  Please sort your information out.  Very disappointed.
